data.prayer: Jesus, help the local leaders in Al Jifarah, Libya not be proud but humble, and willing to wash the feet of all they serve.
data.verse: “You call me ‘Teacher’ and ‘Lord,’ and rightly so, for that is what I am. Now that I, your Lord and Teacher, have washed your feet, you also should wash one another’s feet. I have set you an example that you should do as I have done for you.

data.location_label: Photo from the state of Al Jifarah, Libya
data.section_summary: What conditions of religion or environment could you pray for here?

data.prayer: Jesus, all authority was given to you, and you commanded all disciples in Al Jifarah, Libya to make more disciples, and you promised to be with them. May your power and their obedience make more disciples today.
data.verse: All authority in heaven and on earth has been given to me. Therefore go and make disciples of all nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit, and teaching them to obey everything I have commanded you. And surely I am with you always, to the very end of the age.

data.prayer: Spirit, help every believer in Al Jifarah, Libya be prepared to give an answer to everyone who asks them for the reason for their hope.
data.verse: But in your hearts revere Christ as Lord. Always be prepared to give an answer to everyone who asks you to give the reason for the hope that you have. But do this with gentleness and respect.

data.prayer: Spirit, fill the 443,800 souls living in the state of Al Jifarah with a taste for your Word. Make it sweet as honey in their mouth.
data.verse: How sweet are your words to my taste, sweeter than honey to my mouth!

data.prayer: Lord, Let your Kingdom come among the Algerian, Arabic-speaking people. Let your will be done, as in heaven, so on earth.
Spirit, awaken a burning desire for your presence and intimacy among the 443,800 people living in the state of Al Jifarah.
Spirit, guide someone in the church in the state of Al Jifarah to a person ready to receive the message of the gospel, like Lydia, and who will then open her home to faith.
data.verse: One of those listening was a woman from the city of Thyatira named Lydia, a dealer in purple cloth. She was a worshiper of God. The Lord opened her heart to respond to Paul’s message.

data.prayer: Jesus, remind the disciples in the state of Al Jifarah to train each other to obey all that you commanded, and that you will be with them as they do it.
data.verse: and teaching them to obey everything I have commanded you. And surely I am with you always, to the very end of the age."
